meanings.definition: To calculate the total of something.
meanings.sent1: I totalised the number of apples in the basket.
meanings.sent2: She totalised the amount of money she had saved.
meanings.sent3: The robot totalised the number of steps it took to reach the end of the maze.
meanings.sent4: The accountant totalised the expenses for the month with precision.
meanings.sent5: The teacher totalised the scores to determine the class average.

meanings.definition: To combine all parts into a single whole.
meanings.sent1: He totalised all the ingredients to make the perfect cake.
meanings.sent2: The artist totalised various colors to create a beautiful painting.
meanings.sent3: The magician totalised different tricks to create a mesmerizing performance.
meanings.sent4: The chef totalised different flavors to craft a unique dish.
meanings.sent5: The architect totalised different materials to design a sustainable building.
